alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 02 at 9:20AM CST until February 07 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Pickens and Sumter Counties. .Rainfall totaling 2 to 4 inches is expected over the Tombigbee River basin through early Friday morning. A flood warning is now in effect for the Tombigbee River for anticipated water rises. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 109.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning to a crest of 124.1 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
